repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p:
A multi-text manuscript, entitled Cāstiram Aintu on its additional title page, containing several works on traditional medicine:
The Cuntara-nūl ("Book of beauty"), text in 33 verses (U2).
The Rāmatēvar paṭcaṉi (enlisted on the title page as Irāmatēvar vētānta paṣṣiṉi), appears to be a text of Tamil Siddha tradition, which concers supernatural powers, practices related to magic and yoga, in 108 verses (U3).
The Rōmariṣi-cuvāmi cūttiram aṉpatu (Urōmariṣi cūttiram – 50, "50 [Verses] of the Treatise of Rōmariṣi") appears to be a text of Tamil Siddha tradition in 51 verses (U4)
The Rōmariṣi-cuvāmiyar cūṣttiram patiṉāṟu (Urōmariṣi cūttiram – 14, "14 [Verses] of the Treatise of Rōmariṣi"), appears to be a text of Tamil Siddha tradition on practices related with yoga, in 16 verses (U5).
The Rōmariṣi-cuvāmi nūṟu cūṣtiram (Urōmariṣi cūttiram – 100, "100 [Verses] of the Treatise of Rōmariṣi" ) appears to be a text of Tamil Siddha tradition related with alchemy and yoga (U6).

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil folation in left margin. Arabic library foliation (lf) in pencil on right margin.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Title Page (additional). No Tamil foliation = Library foliation A.

9 folios = Cuntara-nūl. Tamil foliation 1-9 (at several folios unblackened) = Library foliation 1-9. The first folio is blank, except for the title and unblackened text written in the column in the left part of the folio (f[1]r). Initial part of the text is missing (f2r starts with the verse no 3). Folio 3v is unfinished: it ends with the verse no 8, while folio 4r starts with the final part of the verse 11.
25 folios = Rāmarēvar paṭcaṉi. Tamil foliation 1-25 = Library foliation 10-34.
9 folios = Rōmariṣi-cuvāmi ruttiram a[i]ṉpatu. Tamil foliation {1}-9 = Library foliation 35-43.
6 folios = Rōmariṣi-cuvamiyar cūṣttiram patiṉāṟu. Tamil foliation {1}-6 Library foliation 44-49.
27 folios = Rōmariṣi-cuvāmi nūṟu cūṣtiram". Tamil foliation {1}-27 = Library foliation 50-76.
1 folio = guard leaf. No Tamil foliation = Library foliation 77. Blank recto verso.

supportDesc.condition: Very good state of preservation, in spite of bore holes caused by insects.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 135 (front cover, recto).
BnF bequest sticker DON N° (front cover, recto).

Left-marginal intertitles:
mataṉa-vaciyaM
tampaṉa-maiyimai vaciyaM

tampaṉa-vaciyaM
Wholly unblackened. Later addition.
tampaṉam vaciyaM
Uccaraṭiṉa-p-pukaiWholly unblackened. Later addition.
śrī ṟi Āṭai cor
kaṭuṅkāṉi
kāyaveṭṭ' aṟāmal

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: Rōmariṣi Cūttiram 50 (U4) internally to the year vicu of the Jovian cycle, that is, 1821-1822, 1761-1762, 1701-1702, etc. See colophon (U4, f9v1). Rōmariṣi Cūttiram 14 (U5) internally to the year vicu of the Jovian cycle, that is, 1821-1822, 1761-1762, 1701-1702, etc. See colophon (U5, f6v1). No internal date. Dated to circa 1780 by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) and to 1780 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 25, n0. 135..
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 37r, no. 135.

Vinson, Julien 1868. Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — See p. 37, no. 135. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49).

encodingDesc.p: Transliteration conventions ― Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). ― Abbreviations ― c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso, 1c = first column, 2c = second column, 3c = third column

revisionDesc.change: Updated to TST encoding and edited by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Revised by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 1, May 2022.

seg.seg: tantimukattōṉ cataṅkaittāḷē kāppu cakalaporuḷāy nirainta tāyār kāppu munti uraittēṉ mutanūl aṉpatukkuḷ [aimpatukkuḷ] mūla mutt=tiṟikōṇa vāci vātam cuntaram pōl aṟivuṭaiya makkaḷukku tōṭu kuṟiyum iṭi nilamun tōṇun tōṇum intav urai patiṉāṟu coṉṉēṉ rōmariṣi nūlukk etira nūl oṉṟum illai t=tāṉe ~ 1 ~
